column5: None

column2: Good quality in a smaller TV
column5: I wanted a TV to wall-mount in my bedroom where I have limited space. I was a little surprised to learn that it's actually getting difficult to find a top-quality TV in a smaller size these days - this Samsung was about the best we could find in a 32" model. Still, despite it's small size, it does have all the essential features, as well as a very good picture quality.The TV itself is very light weight and was easy to wall mount. I used an articulating arm mount that lets me tilt and position the TV any way I want, and the light weight helped make this easy. The TV remote is the same as other recent Samsung TV's use, so if you're used to the layout, it will seem very comfortable to you.This is a "smart" TV, meaning that it has apps for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime Video and many others available. With a fast internet connection, you should have no trouble watching whatever you like through the TV, even if you're a cord-cutter. It's probably a small thing to most people, but I also appreciate that the power draw - especially when the TV is off - is very low.I'd rate the picture quality as very good overall, with a nice bright picture that's sharp and contrasty with most content. Black levels are good, and about the only thing I notice is a certain "harshness" that's common to lots of TV's these days. I admit, I was a plasma holdout, and now my main TV is a 75" OLED just to avoid this issue, so I may be a little more sensitive than most.Overall, if you need a good quality smaller Smart TV that's still capable of putting a nice quality image in front of you, then this Samsung is definitely worth a try.

column2: A Wonderful Smaller TV for a Good Price
column5: If you'd like a not-large TV, this will very well work for you, and I'm glad Samsung decided to make a current (2018) model in this size. The hardest part of the set up for me was attaching the two little stands (at each end of the set, for placing the TV on a table or stand)--you need a screwdriver, and I found it not easy insert the 4 screws. Also, it takes a while to follow the on-screen instructions to connect the TV to WIFI and to register the TV with Samsung. Too bad that the remote does not have a voice-activation feature, as you have to input quit a bit of info, one character at time, but I guess that's what you have to do now with any other "smart" TV. Two suggestions: 1. The stands (as well as the TV) are very lightweight and it seems it would be very easy to tip the set over if you're not careful, so I used black duct tape to "secure" the stands to my stand, and that works fine; 2. Consumer Reports has a feature wherein if you input the make and model #, it will prescribe settings that you should follow for an optimal TV picture. (Of course you have to subscribe to CR in order to take advantage of this feature, unless you know someone who is a subscriber.) I must say, that worked very well for me. I sit about 5 to 6 feet away from the TV, and, frankly, I wanted a set size that wasn't overwhelming and "too too," if you know what I mean.

We have had trouble with this tv not turning on right.  One day, it just wouldn't turn on at all.  Luckily, my IT guy at work told me to unplug it (we have one at our Library that is the same model)....it worked.  Then, last week, the screen turned a funky shade of blue.  Turning off then on didn't clear the problem but unplugging it did.  Sometimes the sound doesn't come on with the tv.  I don't know what's up with this model but it definitely isn't my old Samsung.  Not satisfied at all.

I bought this on sale at Amazon during the Christmas holidays. It came when promised and I set it up with the help of the cable guy. I wanted to make sure I didn't screw it up. The picture, sound, and size were better than what I had expected. For five days I was in bliss. This was going to be a good year. All my favorite show would be a joy to watch. On the sixth day in the morning, I tried to turn the TV on with the cable remote. The cable box came on, but the TV did not. I tried the remote that came with the TV. Nothing. I tried again with the manual button and got nothing. I sent it back for a refund. Then I ordered another one just like the first. What would be the odds of two TV's doing the same thing? ( I really could have used Mr. Spock.) I set it up and it worked great. The next morning the same thing happened. This time I unplugged it, waited 30 seconds and plugged it in again. It worked. I called Sam Sung and spoke to an agent and told him everything. He said that the TV was making an adjustment and to give it a week to see if that would correct it and to call back if it happened again. Well, it happened again. This time he wanted me to unplug it and wait for 60 seconds, replug it and see if it happens again. If it does it again I'll speak to a supervisor. The model number isUN32N5300AF. I try to be patient with people and let them solve problems that come in front of them. I'm retired and I'm getting old. Some people may think me a fool, but I believe in giving people a chance. However, I can only go so long then things must change for the better. I hope this will help people in their choices. I hope you have better luck than me.

column2: Good Value For Smaller Smart TV
column5: Purchased this smart tv to replace older tv with a cable box.  Now that I only stream, it was important to have a tv of different sizes for different rooms.  This Samsung fit the bill with excellent picture, very good price and the internal menu system lends itself to all streamers.  The setup easily hooked up to my internet.  Nothing to dislike.

I had to return this TV because every time I turned it on, it said it couldn't connect to my wi-fi. I tried the "Troubleshooting" feature, but each time I had to unplug the TV and plug it back in. Then it would work. I also found the streaming menu tedious. When a "sponsored" app popped up on the menu ahead of the apps I actually use, it was the last straw. I'm not willing to call support to try and figure out why I have to unplug the TV each time I want to use it. I'll buy a Vizio.

column2: Great Price for a quality TV
column5: Great Price for a quality TV. We bought this to replace the current TV we have in our guest room. It was very easy to mount on wall with existing hardware we already had. Extremely light weight, awesome picture and plenty of options
Recently started having an issue where I'll get the sound but no picture. Have to power cycle the unit to get a picture. Week past the return deadline means I'm stuck with it.

Purchased as a replacement for a Vizio that went kaput.Amazing picture quality when we turn it on.Easy to use with remote and a wide variety of programming choices.We use this with a Roku Stick and it works great.Seller sent this quickly, well packed and in perfect condition.Highly recommend if you're looking for a TV for a smaller space.

Two weeks after purchase, the TV would not turn on or off.  I’ve made numerous phone calls to Samsung customer service and still no resolution.  First was a software update then unplugging the TV was the “solution” and now I’ve waited weeks for new power cord.  Still no fix after four months.  this was “escalated” to supervisors.  Horrible customer service and bad product.  This will go in the garbage and be my loss.
None

I wrote a review awhile back explaining the problems I was having with my first Samsung 32” inch that was returned and now I’m writing this review about the one that replaced it. It has the same exact problems! Sometimes the tv won’t turn on until you pull the plug for a few seconds then plug it back in, sometimes it turns on with distorted sound so pull the plug to fix that and sometimes the sound to picture timing is off. I’m not an expert when it comes to electronics but, I believe most of the issues are caused by the smart  part of the tv. It acts like a computer that is busy doing something or has jammed up due to lack of computing power. I’m hoping that Samsung will come out with a software update that will fix this problem but, if they don’t do something soon I can see this losing lots of customers for them. Every tv in my house is a Samsung and I’ll be looking elsewhere in the future. I will say that when it works, it’s got a great picture but so do other tv out there today.

column2: Not so good. Not even close.
column5: This TV worked well for about a month and then it would not go on when we use the remote. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in and it worked. It's a good TV if you don't mind unplugging and plugging it in again. Well it just keeps getting better all the time. I received an update the other and it felt it needed to be set up all over again. It went ok until it asked what language I spoke and now 3 days later I still cannot select my language. So I have no working TV. I am so sorry I wasted my money on this tv.

column2: VOCs are intense and do not dissipate over time
column5: We returned this product after giving it plenty of time to breathe.  The VOCs are at an unhealthy level.  The plastic is certainly of a very poor quality.  VOCs are harmful to children's (and adult's) health.  I do not recommend this product.

The tv turns itself on. Randomly. During the day, at night. Reading through the pages and pages of others' complaints, the samsung moderators do not share anything of value. Fixes are not readily found, but complaints date back more than a year, and quite common looking at the number of them. TV is ok but i have concerns regarding this long term. Also, the delivery of this product was challenging as a signature was needed but not clearly identified when purchased.

Unfortunately, I have received this TV broken - the screen was severely damaged, and I had to return it. Ordered a replacement from Walmart, which arrived in 2 days with free shipping! Overall, its a good TV with a very decent picture and sound quality for a small set. Also, it is one of the better TVs of this size, and it is very easy to mount in a small space. However, there a few things to consider before buying it. First, it appears to be overpriced. For $40 more you can buy a 50-inch Samsung smart TV, 6-series, which is much better then this one in every possible way. Second, the speakers are relatively loud, but the sound is a little distorted - somewhat metallic and unpleasant. Third, the picture is very bright, but the colors and contrast are not quite realistic. Perhaps the greatest disappointment is a not so smart (and somewhat irritating) "smart" component. Whereas the TV comes with preloaded applications, the setup is not user friendly, and Samsung does allow for any meaningful customization. Moving from one application to the next, changing channels and viewing guides is much more difficult compared with streaming devices, such as Roku. Also, there are almost no additional applications, which can be downloaded from the Samsung store. I have another (older) Samsung TV, which works much better for streaming Internet content than this one (with a Roku streaming stick, which can be purchased for $30-45). One advantageous feature is an inbuilt browser. However, it's is hardly usable without a keyboard and mouse.

Picture quality is wonderful. The auto-ambient light feature is amazing. Never have to worry about glare due to the angle of the sun/time of day. Extremely light weight. Setup was easy and straight forward. I am not thrilled with the remote/ease of use. I stream only, so expected getting to Netfix and Amazon Prime would be easy-peasy one click, but it takes a number of clicks of buttons and navigation arrows to get to the apps. The remote does not have a back light which is frustrating. imho, not particularly user friendly.  Also was disappointed there is no headphone input or bluetooth to use an external portable speaker.Overall, excellent picture quality at a very good price. The wifi connection has been dependable (no dropped connection so far) Remote is pretty bad.

I bought two of these Samsung UN32N5300AFXZA 32" TV's.  BOTH require frequent unplugging/plugging to get them to reset because they will not turn on, won't turn off, or the sound echoes horribly.  (One was to replace another 32" Samsung smart TV which never had a problem.)  The one Samsung tech I spoke with was not helpful and would not listen closely to my simple explanation  about the problem.  Very disappointed with this product and Samsung's customer service.  ZERO stars!!

I am a long time Samsung fan and this tv was to replace and older Samsung 720I, my first one quit working after a couple of weeks, no picture or sound. I inquired about a replacement, which they did, however lied about shipping it back to me. I did my part and had it picked up in less than 24 hours, called and emailed the supplier that it had shipped, he told me that they would expedite the delivery, not! It took 5 days to receive and never sent a tracking number. As for the TV, I expected a great tv, but this one, like the other one, has a decent picture, not what I would call HD, the setup was very easy, the sound is fine. It is a disappointment and I should return this one and get a Sony.

column2: Questionable quality from the 3rd party seller.
column5: This review isn’t about Amazon or even the Samsung tv itself.  I’m sure it’s perfectly nice.  I’ve bought Samsung products in the past and they’ve all been of good quality.  That being said, I’m starting to believe this seller passed off a used item as new.  I’m having issues turning the tv on first thing in the morning.  Also, some of the preset options in the settings weren’t set on a default but already seemed like someone had changed them.  There are numerous things I’ve had to deal with since receiving this item that makes me believe this seller sent me a lemon.

Quite satisfied so far. Fast shipping, correct product description. Love the picture quality! Got it to replace my 40” Visio for my bedroom and am so much happier it fits better has better picture and access to waaaay more apps.
None

Bought the TV it arrived and would not turn on. The box looks like it’s been sent to a multitude of other people previously or otherwise dragged through the proverbial hedge, backwards and frontwards. Been watching blackness for hours. Not happy, and tired.

column2: THIS IS THE WORST TV THAT I EVER OWNED😡
column5: The TV has a mind of it’s own!  It shuts off or turns on by itself. (That’s if it goes on at all). After months of frustration, I finally believe that there is something wrong with the  “Smart TV”, which I never use, Sometimes the Smart apps come up with a blue screen. NO PICTURE or SOUND. Other times nothing happens at all. If I unplug the TV (which is very difficult for me, I have nerve damage in my back), then wait a minute, and plug it back in it comes on. Then the cycle starts over again the next time I try to put it on. 😡 Many reviewers have the same problems.Many more issues, sound, picture & changes channels. Turns on in the middle of the night. I wanted to return it, but my son-in-law threw the box out when he set it up.

Picture, auto dimming feature & volume good. Used as a bedroom tv; after changing settings for menu screens to dark I decided to keep, otherwise way too bright for nighttime use. USB input was high on my required list, but it does not play AVI files, some MKV files have no sound. Biggest disappointment is the remote: select button not easily distinguishable via Braille, buttons small & abundant. Menu & navigation is easy to mess up requiring a do over. Menu screens require multi buttons to ‘exit’ after selection. Sleep timer needs a 90 minute option (30-60-120-180). Disappointed but competition for this size TV with same options is nil.

I am very pleased with my  Samsung 32" 1080 p TV.  There are a lot of cheaper 32" TVs out there but the Samsung is an excellent product.  I can tell the difference between 720 p and 1080 p and the installation could not have been easier.  Following the installation instructions on the TV was simple. I made all the HDMI connections for the TV and Roku.  Samsung has everything already built in, I identified my wireless internet provider and Direct TV; the setup made all the connections and it took 20 minutes, that includes adding the feet to the TV.  I had to call Direct TV to get their remote control to take 100% control of the TV,  but we figured it out.
WHEN I PLUG IT END SMELLED LIKE WIRES BURNING,THE REMOTE WOULD'N'T TURN THE SET ON.

column2: Like this brand better than Sony
column5: Excellent television for the price.  Very clear picture and sound is very good. Very pleased with my purchase

The picture is excellent, but the sound not so much. Turned all the way up to "100", whatever that means, sometimes the audio is barely audible. Watching some movies it's almost impossible to hear and understand the dialogue. And with musical performances, it's even worse. The one thing that can be said is that even turned up all the way, there is no distortion. But that doesn't make up for the lack of volume.(EDIT) The sound issue has just become more and more annoying. Watching movies is a pain. In order to hear the dialogue in most movies the volume MUST BE turned up to 100. And sometimes that's not enough! We've resulted more than once to turning on captioning Just So we can know what's being said. This is VERY ANNOYING! We never had that problem with the TV this one replaced. If we could send it back, we certainly would!

I am a Samsung TV fan and this TV will not change that.  It was inexpensive and it is beautiful to watch.  I am a very happy owner of this device.It was easy to set up and the only problem I had was trying to use the remote app on my phone, which I had to give up on due to problems with the setup software, but I was never going to use my  phone as a remote so I don't really care about that.  The TV remote works great and I usually use the universal remote that came with my cable box.  I use the TV remote when I watch Netflix or Amazon Prime videos.I recommend this TV and would buy it again.

Picture quality is excellent. Easy setup, physically and electronically. Bought for Firestick setup and that was easy. I am 83 and using my third Firestick. This tv is for the bedroom. Recommend this tv for those who are looking for a 32 inch quality tv.

column2: Disappointed with Direct TV Now on this Samsung TV
column5: I purchased this Samsung TV because it lists built-in support for the "Direct TV Now" streaming app. I was expecting a more polished, seamless integration of streaming TV but discovered the app remains in beta on this Samsung device, and found it to be an inferior experience compared to "Direct TV Now" on an Apple TV. Specifically "Direct TV Now" was slow to load, slow operating, and the picture remained pixelated longer. Basic functions while operating the App do not intuitively correspond to the Samsung remote contributing to a confusing experience; pressing channel up/down doesn't work (you press left and right arrows instead to change channels); pressing Guide instantly exits the app and presents the Samsung guide.
None

column2: HDMI connector problems, get warranty or a different model.
column5: We bought this TV on July 6, 2018 and it failed on July 8, 2019.  The unit would not power on after a power outage and when it power back on, the both HDMI connections failed.  We have tried several recommended fixes such as unplugging and waiting to connect each HDMI device separately and it still will not recognize any HDMI devices.  I plugged a different TV into the same devices and they connected immediately.  This happened once previously and was corrected by replacing the cable. Now we see the cable works, but it was the TV itself that was defective.  We believed Samsung to be more reliable than Sony but it appears we will need to try another manufacturer.
Damaged
This is a nice TV, set it up for a customer to use as a large display for his computer.Very good picture!!!

column2: Don’t buy this model of Samsung TV.
column5: I have owned other Samsung TV’s and they have been very good. This TV’s sound would periodically go off and the only way to get back was to shut the TV off and then turn it back on. The other problem was at times it would not turn on and the only way to get it to turn on was to unplug the TV, leave it unplugged for a couple of minutes, plug it back in and then it would turn on. When I called their technical department they said it was because the remote needed to be fully discharged by removing the batteries. Who the heck they were talking to an idiot? I think I was talking to one. Remotes do not hold a charge that needs to be discharged. Poor tech help.

column2: Sharp, vivid picture, great sound, perfect size for a bedroom or den.
column5: I purchased this "smart" TV based on owning a Samsung Blu-ray player that has been an excellent product and on Amazon customer reviews.  It really is pretty smart 😄.. The picture is crisp and clear with vivid color. The sound is also excellent. Unfortunately my Blu-ray player wasn't a supported model for the Smart things phone app, but this is not a big deal for me. The TV recognized it on the HDMI port 2 and allows me to label it as I please.  Just the perfect size for our bedroom.  It is connected with our DirecTV Genie and the set up was easy.  Would definitely recommend this TV.

I expected to have to jump through hoops to get this tv set up with my external antenna and my Amazon Fire TV system but was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was. The picture is excellent and the remote works great even with my fire setup. The only complaint is that there is no easy way to use Bluetooth headphones with the set. It can possibly be done but requires you to purchase an adapter from optical to RCA.If you are looking for a second tv and don't need a headphone connection, this is a good one to look at

A gentle bump to the table this tv was on sent the screen topling over. Luckily I caught it and there was no damage. The other annoyance is that every time you turn it on it’s programmed to be on a loud commercial channel of some kind instead of a silent, standard menu, like I’ve become used to.Overall, good picture and sound.

column2: Good Picture - Not a fan of the "smart" options
column5: The picture on the TV is great as we bought it for a side-room for occasional viewing.  I'm not a fan of the samsung smart TV capabilities compared to my sony it appears to be very limited and ended up getting an Amazon fire-TV stick to put on the TV as my kid seems to be able to navigate that much more intuitively.

If you are looking for a good quality 32-inch TV for a reasonable price, this would be a good choice. Easy assembly and setup. Excellent picture quality. This is the second Samsung smart TV I have purchased in the past 18 months, so I knew what to expect, and not only was I not disappointed, but my expectations were actually exceeded. The only thing about these TVs is, the best picture quality (IMO) does not come enabled out of the box. You have to select Dynamic in the picture options menu in setup. The difference is night and day (again IMO). I've had very good luck with Samsung products, including several computer monitors, phones and of course TVs, and they have universally been of very high quality, trouble free and long lived. Highly recommended overall.

column2: I truly enjoy this TV, except for one thing!
column5: The picture quality is very good. Once in-awhile I see lines across the top of the screen. Also every now and then the TV speaker sound is distorted. If I fast forward or go back a second, it clears it up. Other people have also complained about this problem.  In general, the sound quality is also very good. Not sure where this sound distortion is coming from.  I must contact Samsung.
None

I bought this TV for my wife for her office and she loves it!  The picture is sharp and clear, and the sound quality very good for a TV of this size class.  She has limited space, and the light weight makes it very easy to turn out of the way when not in use, and pivot back to watch.  We have had very good luck over the years with Samsung TVs, and this one appears to maintain that streak of excellent quality and performance for a reasonable price.
I am not a good person to review TVs.  I don't know that much about them.  The TV arrived, I plugged it in, and I can watch Gunsmoke.  Beyond that, I really can't add anything.

Very happy with this purchase! We actually just pull this out from time to time because it's so easy to store. Very lightweight and thin. Can be used with any and all apps an Apple TV can. The only annoying thing is that the app is useless so where you think it would help (mainly with navigating around the screen and typing in text for searching or logging in) it doesn't. So it's not very easy to search or login to things, or do something like change wifi. But overall it's a great TV, the quality is great, and it's very portable.

I just installed this TV and it works pretty well but I have not used all the features yet.  The one thing that was mentioned in other reviews was that sometime the TV will not turn on.  This happened to me once so far.  I followed what "support" said and unplugged it and then plugged it back in.  It worked!  I have not had the problem again, so far.  There is a "bug" in their software some place.  FIX IT SAMSUNG!  I bought this because of your reputation.  Right now I am going to use a power strip that has some "hot" outlets so I do not have to turn off the other components to "fix" this problem.  Come on Samsung, fix this problem.

column2: Terrible TV set and the worst customer support from Samsung
column5: Purchased this TV for my kitchen. Developed a problem that the TV would not turn on. After checking the remote which was ok the only way to get the TV to turn on would be to unplug and re-plug the power after 5 minutes. This is very difficult as the TV is wall-mounted and the plug is behind the TV. I returned the TV for a new one and the same problem occurred. I contacted Samsung and for 2 hours worked with a technician to install an upgrade to the firmware. The TV still had this problem. I spoke to Samsung and asked them to send me a different model TV or do something to help me. They have the WORST customer service. They insist that all they can do is have me send the TV back to Samsung and have a technician validate the problem, then they might send me a different TV or replace it with the same model. The customer service supervisor was rude, left me on hold for almost 30 minutes and could care less if she could help me or not. Very poor unprofessional behavior.
Can't just turn it on and watch TV.  Have to go through this "smart" menu every time you turn it on.
I have this mounted in my semi truck. It has worked flawlessly after hitting every bump, pothole and construction zone in the US. This tv works perfectly after all of that.

Bought this tv May 19, 2019. On July 12,2019 tv stopped responding to any remotes. Contacted Samsung customer service 3 times before they would finally admit it needed service. Each time had to go thru the painful steps of unplugging, pulling batteries and trying this and that for each tech person I got passed to.  It is being serviced as I write this. I have had great experience in the past with Samsung tvs. Not so sure anymore.

This tv is just ok....randomly it won't turn on, so I have to literally unplug it, wait, plug it back in and then manually turn it on! Unacceptable. Smh. Makes me believe this isn't a true Samsung television! Why you ask, because my other 6 Samsung televisions do NOT do this, ONLY the one I purchased through Amazon.

column2: Good TV, but mine was defective and not new as ordered
column5: I ordered a new TV but received one that had been previously opened.  The sound was distorted.  I contacted Samsung for help, they did a remote login to the TV so "we could troubleshoot the problem together", and after a while the service person would no longer respond to me - apparently was not able to help and didn't say so but ended the support call.  I purchased a new identical item from a local retailer that I am very satisfied with - the sound is good.  I am returning the item I bought from Amazon for a refund.
None

Our last one was also Samsung. I cant believe how much sharper the picture is, read the text much more easily, sharp clear sound, super light weight. And cost almost $200 less than 3 years ago when I got the last. Awesome buy, easy set up. Same size.. 32 inch. What an amazing buy.

BUYER BEWARE! I purchased this TV through a third party on Amazon, and was pleased with the TV, up until 2 months ago.The TV had an issue, which I contacted Samsung about. They provided me the name of a company to get it repaired at, and authorized the repair.I had the same issue a month later, and contacted Samsung again for repair. After I brought it in for the second time I was contacted a well later and was told they weren't going to try another repair, and would exchange the TV.A week after the email stating this I was contacted by their exchange department and was told they were not going to replace it, or refund my money, as the TV was bought through a third party, which was on Amazon.No where did it state that there would be no warranty in this instance, even though they repaired it once, under warranty. I even registered it on the Samsung account right after I bought it, and there was nothing that started that this product would not have a normal warranty.What a terrible example of "customer service".I have had a Samsung phone for many years, and now am considering never buying another Samsung product.

column2: I love my Samsung LED TV.
column5: My new Samsung TV is wonderful.  It is hard to believe that a picture can be so clear and the colors so vivid.  It was easy to set up.  I would recommend a Samsung to anyone who asks.
Picture quality is excellent. I like the Smart TV features. Set up was a little cumbersome but we got through it. We did not need anything to connect to wireless for streaming channels. Great value

column2: Great picture, Easy to use Smart TV
column5: I love Samsung products & this TV  is no exception. The picture is brillant, crisp & clear.The smart options are easy to use & starting up apps. like Netflix or Hulu are simple.

I needed a TV in another location.  Only a couple weeks ago did I order this same model number for living room.  Satisfied with first purchase I returned to Amazon to order another, just like it.  Yes, both are doing their job.  Thanks!

column2: Samsung Electronics UN32N5300AFXZA 32" 1080p Smart LED TV (2018), Black
column5: Whole my life with the other brand of S., but with Samsung that is now 2nd day at my bedroof working lot much better than Sony., and next larger TV in living room is Samsung again...wifi works with 25Mbps speed 10 times better than old brand yet...good buy

I am enjoying this TV!  Due to where I put my TV I couldn't get one much bigger than the one I had, but this is just a little bit bigger. The picture is nice and sharp and the sound is good. One of the reasons I chose this TV is because of the "feet" - I needed something flat and not on legs.  I would recommend this TV!

column2: pretty good tv for the price
column5: i like this tv,pretty good for a smart tv  and the price i paid,i need to study it more cuz i heard you could stream from your tablet to this tv i need to verify that and if thats true this is a great tv and i recommend it to anyone whos shopping for a 32 samsung smart tv

this is a replacement for my last Samsung TV,  could not be happier. highest resolution for 32" TV, my only wish would be for a 32" 4k resolution. connecting to local network simple and stable. i did not experience lost connection as others have noted.Great picture and good sound. would be nice to have additional usb connector as older model and external headphone jack.But i definitely recommend this TV for bedroom use.
None

THIS TV HAD SMALL PROBLEMS FROM THE GET GO .SPEAKERS NOT GOOD PLUS AT THE RIPE AGE OF 8 MONTHS I HAVE TO TAKE IT 50 MILES FROM MY HOUSE.THEN GO BACK TO PICK IT UP .YOU HAVE TO SEND IN FOR REPAIRS 2 TIMES FOR REFUND .HAD T BUY ANOTHER SET FOR REPLACEMENT WHILE I WAIT .THE PICTURE GOES IN AND BACK OUT
Really loved the picture but if you're relying on the onboard speakers for audio, be careful.  You might want to invest in a sound-bar or invest in another TV.
Nice television! Right now, I am having trouble getting it to work properly with my Fire Stick but it has a crisp sound and the colors are beautiful and vivid!!

Awesome tv with excellent colors.  Black looks black and motion is not blurred.  Still wish Samsung would do better with their native speakers but that is not uncommon with televisions and the reason for sound bars and the like.

column2: Samsung Smart LED TV's are the best on the market!
column5: I love my Samsung Smart LED TV!  It is the best on the market for the price!  I appreciate how easy it is to set up!  We purchased this for our guest room.  We have multiple Samsung Smart LED TV's in our home. The picture is clear and the color is vibrant!  Our family is sold on the quality of Samsung products!

column2: Works nice until you can use it...
column5: Everything went smoothly at first , did all the updates used the apps, watched some cable.Two days later the remote would not turn the TV on. Bought this at 'B-Buy'. Kept it two days. Traded it for '5500 Series'. Talked to Samsung.. [Said] What you get? Is what you get!Pro: Was a BEAUTIFUL picture.. That was about all?!CONS: Wobbly feet. Tipping over forwards? Samsung insists you have an account, including Credit Card number! (For your own convenience) "Smart TV" UI, more like a giant 'Pop-Up' ad!? Full of sponsored links! Samsung admitted; CAN'T get rid of advertisements? (Built into the Firmware)More CONS: Speakers were small and 'tinny'. Lacked I/O ports.. (The '5500 Series' has three HDMI ports. Toslink out, and 'line level' PCM audio out. Better speakers. Dual USB ports. One for 'stick', and another for HDD. Better 'Blue Tooth', etc.)Don't understand WHY Samsung left out the 'Bells and Whistles' on this TV? Why Samsung insists on selling the consumer something that looks more like a 3rd rate Web Browser? Full of 'Adware'? (Already got enough commercials on TV?)Finally. Samsung insisted. This 'N5300 series' Smart TV? Actually has 2017 Firmware! Although it says (2018), [in parenthesis]? IF you're counting on Samsung to support 'upgrades' to this TV Software, the next 10-years? Good luck?Not for us.. Took the choice, and said NO! We're not putting up with it...

column2: My Research Bore Out: FANtastic TV
column5: 32" is perfect viewing in small room size. Picture quality & sound: outstanding (disagree with reviews that are negative on sound & say you need a separate soundbar). Feet/stand very secure, but note that you'll need a 'skinny'/thin flat screwdriver to attach (single handle where you can change bit sizes will likely be too thick to fit inside). For extra safety I plan to use Gorilla Duck tape to attach to table (but am waiting to first buy/receive a height adjustable up to 9" swiveling base). Setup/connection very easy (back of tv clearly color coded to wires; on screen setup fast & simple without needing mobile phone app). You will need to know your WIFI password to enter during setup. Best TV I've ever had! Family loves it. Seems silly to me that people buy lesser quality brands for very small $ savings over this TV (especially when a TV is a long term purchase). In my opinion Samsung is best TV (LG used to be a close second, but now a far second; cheaper Insignia TVs are a far third if you're really tight on every dollar). MSRP on this TV increased this year, but sale prices are actually lower than past years!Only small negative is the included remote control. It's not as ergonomic to hold/use as my Comcast remote (plus I'm used to the keys/location on it). Most remotes though (including Comcast) can be universally programmed to any TV, but you need to know your TV's remote code (took many links/time to find it). For this 2018 Samsung model, it's: 10702. Search up the instructions for entering the code on your remote (yours will be different from mine, & please don't ask me to search for you).

Note: Rating of 3/5 includes the built-in speakers, probably 4(maybe 4.5)/5 not accounting the speakers.Haven't had this television for too long, but I have been messing around with it the past few days. Here are my initial impressions(will edit an update if anything changes).Picture -When it comes to the picture, the picture is adequate. It's not so good out of the box(move those backlight/sharpness sliders down friends!). I used "Movie" mode. The colors are a bit off out of the box, but can be changed to be somewhat manageable. I saw an online review mentioning that "warm2" was the best color temperature for accuracy, however there must be some kind of quality control consistency with these panels, because warm2 looked really bad. Both warm and warm2 produced VERY orange shifted colors, making everything seem coated with carrot color(even black and white). For my television, "Normal" color temperature seemed closest to what I'd assume is more closer to accurate(slightly off-white whites). I left it on "cool" however, to make white - white, for better general viewing. The colors are a bit hyped out of the box, which you'll need to dial down a bit unless you want everyone to look sunburned.This television sort of struggles with the blacks, as expected for IPS, but it's on the worse end. A lot of things will seem a bit on the gray side instead of black. It's difficult to get good blacks without having to mess up the rest of the picture. Speaking of IPS, due to it having an IPS screen, the viewing angles are not bad. There is a slight shift in color/brightness to the sides, but most of the shift for me seems to be noticeable when viewing it from a higher angle.Sound -This is the real downfall for this TV, the sound. It sounds BAD. When I say bad, I mean just really bad. It's both muddied and shrieking at the same time. With the standard sound, male vocals pretty much always sound distorted/muddied and pushed back, while female vocals sound muddied,thin, and fairly upfront. The sound travels fairly far(which is a disadvantage for us, since it can disturb others in the house). The "amplify" sound setting makes it sound a little bit better, but it leaves it sounding very peaky, as when I heard it from another room, all I would hear is the "ch ch ch" sound from the treble when people were speaking.It's one of the worst sounding TV speakers we have in our home. Our older extremely thin smaller LG TV with smaller speakers sounds a lot better, and our similarly sized TCL TV from a few years ago also sounds a lot better. I'm pretty sure my extremely small(smaller than a small plastic cup) bluetooth speaker even sounds better than the TV. When I looked underneath, the speaker seemed like it was quite a decent size, so I'm a bit lost on how it can sound so bad. I very highly recommend you budget a soundbar into the price when purchasing this TV. It's just atrocious sounding. Some notes I wanted to mention is that this TV does not have a 3.5mm output, so you're limited to optical/HDMI, and this television has an equalizer for the built-in speaker(only works for the speaker) with 100 Hz, 200 Hz, 500 Hz, 1 KHz, 2 KHz, 5 KHz, and 10 KHz adjustment points. Lastly, it seems like the more "muddy" sound comes through the vents at the top of the unit. If you can isolate the sound coming from the vents from the bottom, it can sound slightly better(still horrible though).Features/control -It's not as simple to navigate as the TCL Roku TV we had purchased. The menu layout is a bit clunky. Setting options are also quite limited for the device apart from the settings you don't usually find on others(like the equalizer or the white balance settings). The IR sensor seems to be a bit finicky, as sometimes I press the remote and it doesn't respond, unless I'm holding it perfectly, but it also works at unusual angles as well so it's a bit strange.The TV can be a bit sluggish randomly, but it's generally adequate in terms of speed.When it comes to connectivity, this television has a basic Ethernet jack if needed. Its included wireless seems to be ok as well without any glaring performance issues in terms of the wireless.This television comes with a number of pre-installed apps. You can remove them from your "Home" page, however you cannot uninstall these pre-installed apps it appears.Design -No premium design with this set. Its design screams budget, unlike some other sets at this price point that try to add some minor 'premium' design features here and there. Speakers are downward facing on both sides. The TV stand legs does not lift the TV high enough to place other devices(like a DVD player or smaller cable box) underneath.Update Edit:I noticed that there seems to be no way to disable this television's Wi-Fi Direct functionality. There is also no option to automatically deny any Wi-Fi Direct requests. As it stands, Wi-Fi Direct is always on and you will receive a popup on your screen if any nearby device tries to connect. Based on the support articles, older Samsung televisions used to have the option to disable it it seems(or at least enable it if it was disabled).  I don't understand why Samsung feels like this should always be on. My Roku TV allows for both Wi-Fi Direct disabling(assuming you don't use the Wi-Fi Direct remote models) as well as the option to automatically deny any Wi-Fi Direct requests. I had it disabled temporarily by resetting the network settings, but it returned back once the TV was power cycled.Update Edit 2: It seems like HDR content has separate video settings. If you set video settings for SDR content, you're going to have to adjust the settings as well when you end up on HDR content.Update Edit3: We've now had this television for a few months. I have read other reviews concerning this television not turning on. We had not had that happen until today. Tried to turn it on(by remote/button) and the power light would change to indicate the difference, but nothing on the screen/no audio. Had to unplug/replug. Hopefully this does not continue to occur.

column2: Buyer Beware Samsung HDCP 1080P Major Conflicts!!!
column5: Don't make the mistake I did buying a 1080P TV from Samsung that will never display 1080P...  The HDCP copy protection along w/ the firmware from Samsung does not work properly with Blu-Rays or other devices...  I didn't realize I was seeing in 1080i only when I got mine until I tried hooking up a Blu-Ray player... It wont even detect it in 1080P without a disc in it much less play anything legally bought in 1080P... I've seen many who had auto updates turn their TV into useless trash by creating a conflict... I had no idea what HDCP was or anything else, most of the TVs wont even update as they are supposed to... I tried updating my firmware using 3 different USB sticks, deleting every file on them... Doing everything possible... Making the bin file the only thing on the stick... Making its own directory then putting it in there... Putting the file in zipped/unzipped, nothing will even read it, I've been on-line since 300 baud modems... So if are old tech or new, trust me on this, just avoid anything Samsung.  Even the USB port has a copy protection on it forcing to register to supposedly be allowed to use it???  You can't even buy a TV, stick a USB in it to play things without them trying to make it difficult?  I'm basically only given the option to go in pirate sites or use pirated stuff if want to view it... Since the legally bought Blu-Rays or players refuse to allow me to watch what I own/paid for because of bogus HDCP?

column2: Great picture but problematic sound, would stick with Dumb TV
column5: The picture is great, even from the side. The interface is somewhat confusing and a lot to get used to. Based on my experience, I would not buy this more expensive smart TV (or probably any other), but would stick with an Amazon fire or Roku box instead. You are beholden to the TV manufacture's software that has been installed and whether the app you want to run has been written to support the software. As an example,  there is no Acorn app written for Samsung so I have to keep my Amazon fire box connected to this "smart" TV just to see the one streaming service. Amazon Fire/Roku has the best selection of apps.I knew audio would be a problem but I didn't think it would be much of a problem. I bought to TV thinking that I can't do anything to fix the picture, but I have options to get the audio working. First the sound is adequate for my small room. But there are times (movie dialog) when I could use a crisper sound for my old ears. I could not hook up my computer speakers because they have a headphone jack and the TV only has an optical digital output connection. I knew that before the purchase. So I bought a digital to analog converter. I got it to work after changing the settings: audio out changed from TV speakers to optical digital; audio type to PCM. It works but I didn't realize that you cannot control the volume of a digital audio device using the Samsung remote. Volume control is disabled. I don't know if this true for all TV companies but it seems like a ridiculous feature. So if I keep this setup, I will have to get up every time that I want to change the volume. I haven't done that for 20 years. My only option now is to get a sound bar or any other audio device that can be controlled with it's own separate remote control ... add another remote to the coffee table.There was an annoyance in trying to register the TV on the Samsung site. This has to be done if you want to connect to Smart Hub where you can download apps. Here again, Amazon/Roku has a simpler design. The serial number was not accepted on the registration page. After a 30 minute online chat with a Samsung tech, I was told it would have to resolve further up the support chain. I am still waiting.I have only had the TV for 4 days so I am sure I will add to my review as I find more things out.

column2: Fabulous on the second try - odor issue.
column5: Most of our flat screen TVs  have been Samsungs - they have a superior picture quality. We needed a new 32"  to replace our aging 32 which is mounted in a custom built cabinet  - and they no longer make 36" models here so another 32 inch was required. Our eleven year-old unit worked fine but the picture was slowly fading (as was  our aging eyesight). First of all, there are not a lot of choices out there in this size. I went to our local big box discounter and picked up the 32 inch 1080 Samsung smart TV - again, the Samsung  had the best picture on display.It was an easy install, light weight, and had an incredibly clear and bright picture. However, there was an electric smell emanating  from it.  Checking  reviews revealed one reference to this anomaly. We waited three weeks hoping it would dissipate  but it did not.Disappointed, I  returned it to the dealer and immediately bought a recommended Vizio 32 inch 1080. It was an easy  install but we found the picture clearer in some ways but a little muted  - despite all the adjustments you could do - basically it is good  feature filled tv but the picture not to our liking. That unit was returned the same day. Got all the money back.Given the limited market offerings  in 32 inch tvs we  decided to give the Samsung one more try hoping that our previous units was just a lemon. The original dealer had no more Samsungs.Went to another dealer showroom and once again that same 32 inch 1080 Samsung out-shined the competition. The salesmen said that it was their best 32 inch and he had not heard of the odor issue, and knew of no returns  for that model (he looked it up on their in-store system). They had a good return policy (30 days) plus a very affordable 2 year extension, and it had a holiday season mark down of 100$ less (a 33% discount) than I paid for my first one.  Well, again installed it and then waited for the oder, which was barely noticeable compared to the  first unit  and gone after a few days. So...our first unit was really defective.We love the tv.The moral is that anyone buying a tv should see it in person before  buying and make sure that the vendor (online or brick and mortar) has a no fee 100% cash back return policy for  at least one month in case you get a rare defective unit..Good fishing!
None

The picture quality is great - as great as you can hope for with 32" 1080p - but I didn't like the audio quality. It sounded muffled - like something comparable to what you hear from some cheap ear buds bought at Wallgreens (okay, maybe not THAT bad but still bad). My 28" 720p Samsung TV sounded very slightly better. Fortunately, it has an audio output socket so maybe it can be salvaged with external speakers.

column2: It is an excellent tv at it's price point.
column5: What I didn't like is it has a bleach odor.  I think mine is an isolated example.I wanted a 32" tv for < 250 bucks with a wired ethernet port.  Being a Samsung,since I have a Samsung smart phone, was a plus.The smell is mostly gone now, if I hadn't liked it I'd have sent it back to the seller.That freaking sound when the smart apps comes on can be turned off.  You can turn off smart hub.The remote isn't as userfriendly as I'd like but there are so many functions that they need a lot of buttons.I have a raspberry pi plugged into hdmi1 running kodi.  I can control kodi via the remote.  You can't do that via HDMI2 if that matters to you.It works fine with Amazon Prime.  I don't have any other streaming subscriptions.

If you like to use a remote headphone (Miracle Ears, etc) that works thru infra red or, for that matter, ANY headphone, be aware that this model does not have a 3.5 mm (standard) headphone jack. I contacted Samsung and was told NONE of their models do. Since every TV I have purchased in the last 20 years has had a headphone jack (probably adds $1 to cost of production) I have to rate this and all Samsungs unacceptable.

column2: Superb picture - serious design flaw with power cord connection!
column5: I am not sure you can find a better picture in this size, 32 inches. But I don’t understand how the manufacturer could put this product out with the most poorly engineered power connection. The power cord (very short) will barely connect to the tv and falls out if you want to adjust positioning of the tv. Honestly, if the cord is not positioned in the right manner, the power will disconnect. This can’t be good for a tv. I am going to research and contact the company to see if I have a lemon. The picture - superb - powering it a major flaw, I think in this tv.

Samsung has been a go-to for years. These TV's are mediocre unfortunately.1)First one had a pink screen (hardware malfunction).2)Noticeable VOC smell out of box, hoping it dissipates.3)Viewing angles are terrible compared to my 2015 model. Viewing from the side is not too bad, but up or down even a little and the picture goes dark.4)The bezel is clearly separated for the screen on the bottom and sides like they didn't install it correctly or use any adhesive. Even a light touch to the screen in the bottom corners and it pops farther off the bezel.I use this as a computer monitor and a TV and while the picture is good from straight on, all of these issues have me thinking of paying the double cost for a quality monitor. If there are this many visible issues I hate to think of what else is wrong here that I can't see from the outside.I don't use any of the smart features or let them have internet access because that would be stupid. What you really want is a media computer connected to a TV. And I think what I really want, is a computer monitor. Worked great with the TV's from 3 years ago. Not anymore.

column2: Excellent tv, great picture and great sound
column5: I am very satisfied with the tv, but will only give 4 stars because the remote was defective and both my husband and I could not get it opened no matter how hard we tried, my husband even tried using a pair of scissors to try to pry it open and even cut himself in the process, but nothing worked, so we called Samsung to get a new remote sent to us, how disappointing, tv came in 3 days and remote will take 7 days to come, how can a remote door be stuck and not open? It has a button you press in and slide, what could be sticking??? I will say all the reviews say that the tv has a bad tiney sound, my husband and I thought the tv had a very nice sound to it, glad we didn’t invest in a sound bar. Picture quality is excellent! Happy with our purchase.......

column2: READ ALL THE ONE STAR REVIEWS - DON’T TAKE A CHANCE
column5: I bought my Samsung N5300 from a local Big Box (BB) store in December of 2018,  I am throwing it away today.  The same exact issues as described in the 1-STAR reviews here,  TV fails to turn on every few days repeatedly. Of course its after 30 days, so no options with the store.  A call to Samsung and got the same instructions as described here,  only to have that “fix” last for a few weeks instead of a few days but then goes back to the old every-other-day failure.  Hopefully this will give you a hesitation - I’m looking at 18% of us reporting 1-STAR on the AMAZON reviews chart here...

Bought this TV for kids from another retailer.  The sound goes out randomly and the TV will not respond to the power button at times (sometimes it will not turn on/other times it will not turn off).  As stated in an earlier post, Samsung’s answer to all of the issues is to reset the TV by unplugging and waiting a few minutes before turning back on.  This works temporarily however the TV needs to be reset several times a week.  We have now moved it to the guest room to collect dust.  One positive- it does collect dust really well!

column2: Great picture, when it works but the TV seems to have amind of its own.
column5: I was excited to buy this TV, as I have two other Samsung HDTV's that have been great.  I purchased this for our bedroom and was impressed with the picture quality.  However, the sound quality was weak and had to be optimized to listen at a reasonable volume.  Bigger problem was that the TV started cycling and shutting off and on.  The next morning it wouldn't turn on until I unplugged the set from the surge protector and plugged it back in.  I initially thought it was the cable service and had Comcast come out and check everything inside and out.  The tech said the problem was with the TV.  I returned it to the store and got another one as I figured it was just an anomaly and I really liked the picture quality.  The replacement said had the exact same problems.  It took it back and bought another brand.  Do not buy this set!

I bought this TV on the 6th of Dec 2019 so its been only 10 days since I purchased it. I was playing PS4 and the colors went dark and starting to fade, few seconds later, it goes black screen. I turned the TV on/off and still black screen, I could hear the game through my headset so I know its a problem with the TV. I unplugged my HDMI from the TV that is connected to the PS4 to test the TV independently without it being plugged to anything. So I turn the TV on/off few times and still no picture. I could hear the sound in the TV too but no picture. So I went to sleep to see if it over heated or something, woke up the next day and still getting this issue, just black screen. I have like only 10 hours on this TV and already ran through this problem which pisses me off because I have to wait another 5 days since it seems like no body carries this TV in store. I will go return it and order new one from Best Buy (Where I purchased it).Once I get the new one and use it for few weeks, I will update this review but for now, very disappointed that I only got like 10 hours on the TV and already black screen. Don't recommend it to be honest because I seen bad reviews on best buy and here as well
None

column2: Who needs “Stanby” feature on a TV...
column5: Admit we’ve had the TV for only a few days. Need a sound bar without doubt but what we didn’t expect is the “power light” on lower right is really a standby indicator. That means when TV on, no red light but TV “off”  means annoying red light on. Continues to draw small amounts of power maybe not significant but the light should be off when TV off! Not sure if I’ll keep it.

column2: Make sure to buy a sound bar or tower.
column5: Nice form factor, nice look, and excellent video. Only problem? Crappiest audio I've ever heard. Need to buy a speaker!!

I'm in the market for a new TV now thanks to Samsung's black screen.  Literally 4 days after the warranty ran out, a black shadow appeared across the bottom of the TV.  After researching, I found this is common in Samsung smart TVs.  I've been living with it for a few mos and finally a few days ago the entire screen went black - audio works, but not picture.  This is a known problem (but, unfortunately, I didn't know).  There are a lot of better TVs out there without this defect - don't waste your money on the higher-priced Samsung

An okay TV but with the two-part stand that is on each end of the TV rather than having the TV stand in the middle means you will need a place to put it on that is at least 27.5 inches wide - which is a big inconvenience when placing.

column2: Power issue- would not always turn on
column5: Just like other 1 star reviews after one week mine would not turn on unless unplugged for 10 seconds. Happened once a week for two weeks then twice a week, then three. Returned. Took a chance it wouldn’t happen to me after reading the reviews. Not worth keeping it with that issue though other things about the tv were good.

column2: Easy to use/ Slow on shipping
column5: I liked everything about this TV.. easy to set up.. plug in & ready to watch.I didn’t like that I paid for next day shipping and received it 3 days later. No weather issues were involved. This matter HAS NOT BEEN TAKEN CARE OF AS YET.
Bought from Microcenter but returned as soon as I saw the huge power brick. If you want to mount on the wall, this probably isn’t your best option. Picture quality was good in the store though.
The software on this TV is horrible. Vizio smartcast and TCL Roku are light years ahead of Samsung. Samsung does have a good viewing angle though.

I've had two of these.  The first developed wavy lines and a blue haze.  I trashed it and bought another one.  After about a year, it got so it would not start.  Unplugging, then replugging, helped for a while.  Now it doesn't start at all. Back to shopping for a replacement.  If Samsung is supposed to be the best quality, what can I expect from other brands?

TV was terrific...  however, would not turn on/off unless it was unplugged and then plugged back inRepeated attempts over three weeks  to fix via Samsung technicians and through customer service were horrendous and Samsung failed miserably in numerous ways... so much so I will not buy another Samsung product...
None

Tv will randomly turn off and on by itself.  Recently, the tv will no longer connect to my wifi.  It tells me no network is detected.  I have been doing some research had have found a lot of people are having this issue with their Samsung smart tvs.  None of the solutions that are suggested have worked.  Don't waste your money!
Just got the tv, setting it up and it is stuck on select your language, cannot go any further with it. Frustated and mad at myself for spending $250.00 for a piece of junk.

After two weeks of use, the tv does not turn on with the remote. Viewer has to unplug the tv and plug it back in again every second or third time to get the tv to come on.  Samsung is no help with the problem.
Light weight, easy to mount, excellent picture.
